title.narrative: Främja ungdomsarbete genom stöd till TVET
Promoting Youth Employment Through Support to TVET

description.narrative:
Svenska ambassaden i Monrovia har fått en förfrågan från UNIDO för finansiering av USD 6,213,870, uppskattat 55 miljoner kronor för att genomföra Promoting youth employment by supporting technical and vocational education i Liberia för perioden 2018–2023. UNIDO kommer vara huvudansvariga för att implementera projektet.
Projektets övergripande mål är att lyfta unga från fattigdom genom att ge dem ökade möjligheter till en produktiv anställning via ett robust och inkluderande TVET-system (Technical Vocational Education and Training), med kännedom om marknadens ekonomiska behov. Projektet kommer bidra till följande resultat: - ökad kapacitet hos lärare genom formell lärarutbildning som fokuserar på yrkesförberedande utbildning - stärkt kompentens bland befolkningensfärdigheter så att det överensstämmer med de ekonomiska behoven (till exempel infrastrukturutveckling och jordbruk) - öka engagemanget hos privata sektorn för delaktighet inom TVET-sektorn
Utveckling av ungdomar kommer vara i fokus, vilket kommer uppnås genom att stärka och bygga på nuvarande institutionell kapaciteterna hos Liberias tekniska och yrkesförberande utbildnings system för att leverera relevanta kurser som svarar till behoven hos ekonomin.
Projektet kommer adressera både efterfrågan och utbudet på arbetsmarknadens genom att utrusta ungdomar med färdigheter som ökar deras möjlighet till anställning, och som resultat minskar nuvarande hinder för företag att expandera på grund av brist på kompetent arbetskraft.

UNIDO has applied to Sida for funding of USD 6,213,870, aproximately 55 million SEK, to carry out the promoting youth employment by supporting technical and vocational education in Liberia programme during the period 2018-2023. UNIDO will be the main implementing partner.
The proposed intervention overall objective is to lift beneficiaries from poverty by increasing their chances to gain productive employment through a robust and inclusive TVET system (Technical Vocational Education and Training) that is responsive to economic needs. The intervention will support the following outputs: - improved capacity of teachers through participation in formal teacher training for vocational education; - strengthened human capital to correspond to economic needs (e.g. in infrastructure development and agribusiness); - and increased participation of the private-sector in stewardship and engagement with TVET sector at the school level.
Emphasis will be placed on youth development. This will be achieved by strengthening and building on the existing institutional capacity of Liberia's vocational training system to deliver up-to-date training courses relevant to the requirements of the economy.
The intervention will address both labor demand and supply by equipping young persons with skills that increase their employability and earnings, and by removing bottlenecks to expanding profitable businesses due to skills shortages.

The overall objective of the contribution is to lift beneficiaries from poverty by increasing their chances to gain productive employment. The expected outcome is a robust and inclusive Technical and Vocation Education and Training (TVET) system that is responsive to economic needs.

tag.narrative: 4.3 - By 2030, ensure equal access for all women and men to affordable and quality technical, vocational and tertiary education, including university.
4.3 - Senast 2030 säkerställa alla kvinnor och män lika tillgång till yrkesutbildning och eftergymnasial utbildning, inklusive högskoleutbildning, av god kvalitet till en överkomlig kostnad.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.
8.6 - By 2020, substantially reduce the proportion of youth not in employment, education or training.
8.6 - Till 2020 väsentligt minska den andel ungdomar som varken arbetar eller studerar.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
Below are the four objectives of the program and key results for the reporting period:
Objective 1: Improved capacity of teachers, administrators, and principals through participation in formal TVET teacher training and VTC administration/management training. Under this objective, 20 TVET staff were trained in TVET Curriculum development using the DACUM Methodology. The training practical application component drafted job profile standards for the following: Heavy Equipment Operator; Heavy Equipment Repair Mechanic; Small Engine Repair Mechanic for land-based applications; and Small Engine Repair Mechanic for marine/water-based applications. 16 TVET teachers were recruited for overseas training (December 2020), and they were deployed abroad for training in 2021. These 16 recruited TVET teachers signed MoU with the Government and were placed on Government payroll. UNIDO commenced developing eighteen learning Manuals in December 2020 to be used for TVET teachers training. Final drafts of the 18 Learning Manuals were tested/validated in August 2021.
Objective 2: TVET provider infrastructure and delivery system are upgraded to correspond to economic needs. Under this result area the Voinjama Multilateral High School infrastructure design & equipment specification development were completed and actual work on the site began. Rehabilitation work on the Voinjama Multilateral High School was about 50 percent completed in 2021.
Objective 3: Increased participation of the private sector in stewardship and engagement with TVET sector at the school level including in curriculum development and TVET delivery. Within the reporting period, private sector institutions like Acelor Mittal and the Liberian Construction Association have been engaged during the implementation of the program including during discussion on TVET curriculum development and standard setting. Inaugural Occupational and Career Consultative Groups (OCCG) were established in February 2021. The projects are using the Subject Matter Experts from the inaugural OCCG in curriculum development.
Objective 4: Gender sensitized measures to foster enrolment and retention of female, vulnerable youth and people with disabilities are streamlined into TVET provider system. In 2020 the project team reached out to Handicap International and Sight Savers International to gain knowledge in modifying training equipment and curriculum to meet the needs of persons with disabilities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
